definition: school motto
school/military officer/CL:所[suo3]
to proofread/to check/to compare
to teach/to train/to admonish/instruction (from superiors)/teachings/rule

sentences.english: Xue Li Tun goods" is a unique new school motto."
sentences.chinese: “敦品勵學”是學校新穎獨特的校訓。

sentences.english: Motto is be tolerant to diversity, to take the line away.
sentences.chinese: 校訓是海納百川，取則行遠。

sentences.english: Companies should learn from these school mottos.
sentences.chinese: 公司應該向這些校訓取經。

sentences.english: School mottoes are the keys to interpreting normal educational beliefs and traditions.
sentences.chinese: 校訓是解讀師範辦學理念與傳統的鑰匙。

sentences.english: What is the motto of your university?

definition: see a worthy, think to imitate (idiom, from Analects); emulate the virtuous/Follow the example of a virtuous and wise teacher.
to carry out (obligation) conscientiously/to behave sincerely
sense of propriety, justice, integrity and honor (i.e. the four social bonds, 四維|四维[si4 wei2])
It takes ten years to nurture a tree, but a hundred years to train a man (idiom)/fig. a good education program takes a long time to develop/cf. 十年樹木，百年樹人|十年树木，百年树人
old adage/ancient teaching
to preserve a proper behavior in private life
having both integrity and talent (idiom)
sincerity/absolute good faith
see 念念不忘[nian4 nian4 bu4 wang4]
instructing with tireless zeal (idiom, from Analects)
to expound/to propagate
to follow through/to carry through to the end
style of study/academic atmosphere/school discipline/school traditions
to have a sense of shame
unswerving from start to finish (idiom)
motto/maxim
